intro: Mammillaria nivea, commonly known as the white mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and dense covering of white to pale blue tubercles. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 centimeters and features small, woolly spines. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, appearing in the axils of the tubercles. This species is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water and well-draining soil.
